column1: Thank you @The_NAVC for having me as a guest on your podcast today to talk about my bipartisan One Health Act to help prevent zoonotic diseases from turning in to pandemics like we are seeing with #COVID19. Veterinarians play a key role in helping to keep all of us safe! https://t.co/ZliwxdqZCK

@dragonflite1 Thank you for asking. Please consider donating directly to United Way or the Red Cross. Both have designated fire funds. Many shelters cannot take donations of food or clothing due to COVID-19 restrictions.

Many folks have been reaching out asking how they can best help communities impacted by #wildfires. Because of COVID-19 there are restrictions placed on what can be accepted. The linked article below has great info on where and how to donate: https://t.co/Tlbja56tHG

Voting might look a little bit different for some people this year due to #COVID19. If you are an Oregonian with questions about voting by mail where to return your ballot etc...check out my website linked below for more information. #VoteByMail2020   https://t.co/4cob6nqUCA

The application period for Oregon fishing business seeking relief for COVID-19 impacts is now open. Follow this link to learn more about whether you qualify and how to submit an application before the deadline of September 8 2020.  https://t.co/XaBTk3Lb1m
I joined with my delegation colleagues to call for targeted funding for the Latinx community in the next #coronavirus relief package.

The Hispanic community makes up 13% of Oregon's population and they have been disproportionately affected #Covid_19. Many are frontline workers in health care agricultural and outdoor labor factory and warehouse work or grocery and food service.   https://t.co/5qGNeycAlc

Today is #NationalNursesDay and I am so grateful for all of the nurses who have been working around the clock to keep Oregonians healthy during the Coronavirus pandemic. Join me today in thanking our nurses they are truly our healthcare heroes!

I am proud to be a cosponsor of the “Coronavirus Community Relief Act” (HR 6467) which will provide $250 billion for small local governments and rural communities dealing with #Covid_19 . Last month I signed a letter to House leadership urging them to provide funds to rural areas https://t.co/P5yetJSn3L
Catch me live in 10 minutes on @1190KEX. I'll be talking all things #coronavirus and small business.
#CoronavirusRelief

Happy #EarthDay. On the 50th anniversary of Earth Day the coronavirus pandemic reminds us of how fragile and precious our planet is. This pandemic emphasizes why it is so important to address #ClimateChange! https://t.co/ROqxJT6HvS

Even though we’re indoors this #EarthDay let's make time to celebrate & take actions to protect our planet.  Try one of these ideas to engage with the natural world inside your home & at a safe social distance. https://t.co/0eBbFXrEnC https://t.co/0IdXdFVPY9

I know that these are tough times for parents and students alike. Especially our high school seniors who are missing out on so much because of COVID-19. I stand with you all and am proud to be your representative in Congress. https://t.co/v8VboLSr5G
I strongly urge House leadership to include my bipartisan bill in the next Coronavirus response package. @RepTedYoho @AVMACAN @AAVMC @AVMAvets   https://t.co/g87p7XqKeK…

As we continue to social distance and fight #COVIDー19 we must ensure that this does not happen again. My bipartisan Advancing Emergency Preparedness Through One Health Act (HR 3771) will dramatically strengthen our country’s coordinated responses to zoonotic diseases.

REMEMBER: @IRSnews does not initiate contact with taxpayers by email text or social media to request personal or financial information. Taxpayers should be on the lookout for scammers and email phishing attempts about the COVID-19 and Economic Impact Payments!
Do you live in a rural community affected by #Covid_19? Check out this helpful guide from @USDA with specific resources for impacted rural communities:   https://t.co/iJAhtyEjKK

As OR schools start another week of remote learning I wanted to give a thank you to our teachers during this time. I am  impressed by your dedication to your students and how you have risen to the challenges presented by #COVID19 I am proud to be your representative in Congress. https://t.co/8eMEerw1m6

This influx of federal funding will help Oregon’s hospitals especially our rural providers respond to the demands of #COVID19  and will give them the resources that they need to give patients the best care possible.

Today 3454 hospitals in Oregon received a total of $291 million in funding to enhance their coronavirus response efforts through the CARES Act. I am proud to have advocated for these funds and urged Secretary Azar for their immediate release.
Are you a higher ed student wondering how the CARES Act will affect you? Borrowers can expect the following to be implemented this FRIDAY. Follow the thread below:   #CARESAct #Covid_19

If you are looking for accurate information on keeping your family safe and healthy or are a small business owner with questions about accessing assistance check out the links on my website below: #Covid_19 https://t.co/sGGmeWFvm3

ICYMI: Our own Tillamook County Commissioner David Yamamoto wrote an op-ed that was published in the Washington Post urging folks to stay home and not flee to coastal Oregon towns. Check it out! #Covid_19   https://t.co/qs8odJxm8Z
Thank you to all of the health care workers on the frontlines of #Covid_19. We are incredibly grateful to you! #NationalDoctorsDay

This is a comprehensive bipartisan response to the impacts of the Coronavirus that puts resources directly in the hands of those who need it the most.  Visit my website below for more information on COVID-19: https://t.co/i4wGVTsBPD

I just voted with my colleagues from both sides of the aisle on the historic CARES Act that will provide assistance for working families small businesses and our brave health care providers. #COVID19 https://t.co/JGHpPfSTn3

Are you a small businesses owner who has been affected by the Coronavirus and need help accessing an SBA loan? My office is here to help. Call 202-225-5711 and we will connect you with a case worker who can help.  https://t.co/ojQ2fWP2Bg https://t.co/pRrsT2VjpP

If you are a small business owner who has been affected by #COVIDー19 and need assistance getting an emergency loan reach out to my office using the form below or call at 202-225-5711. We will connect you to a staff member that can help.  https://t.co/HTiGO2x6o8 https://t.co/01oyseG594

ICYMI: I have a designated #Covid_19 resource page on my website that is updated regularly with resources and guidelines from trusted sources. It has been updated with SBA disaster loan information as well. Check it out!  https://t.co/i4wGVTsBPD

Stranded in a foreign country due to #Covid_19 ? My staff and I are here to help! We have gotten constituents home from Honduras Peru and got a group of Oregonians stranded in Morocco home today. Reach out using the info below:  https://t.co/HTiGO2x6o8

Please share:  If you are struggling with food instability because of #Covid_19 the Oregon Food Bank has a great tool where you can search by zip code to find the closest pantry or distribution site to you: https://t.co/EtPr7vDMKl  Thank you @oregonfoodbank

In these challenging times let’s do what Oregonians do best and look out for one another. Thank you to our health care workers and first responders who are working overtime to protect us. #coronavirus
Even if #coronavirus isn’t in your community right now social distancing is still super important. It’s the best way to slow spread and #FlattenTheCurve
Please share ! Where to Find School Meals in Oregon During COVID-19 Closures:  https://t.co/0a4YyNjDaq
In the wake of school closures this bill will also ensure that students who rely on free and reduced meals will have access to healthy foods until schools reopen. #FamiliesFirstBill #coronavirus
Early this morning I voted to pass a bipartisan relief package that will ensure that Americans have access to free COVID-19 testing enhanced unemployment insurance and paid emergency leave.

I just voted in support of this overwhelmingly bipartisan emergency spending measure to combat the Coronavirus. This is a strong bipartisan bicameral response and I am hopeful that it gives communities the resources that they need to stay healthy!  https://t.co/zeZ1bdU7C5
Recursos de coronavirus en español vinculados a continuación:  https://t.co/aiGBwnxrsh  https://t.co/n8uxie5alH  https://t.co/fH5W5Rfzpe

Looking for resources on the Coronavirus? I have set up a web page below with federal state and local guidance. I hope that this is helpful to my constituents. Please call my office with any questions and remember to wash your hands!   https://t.co/i4wGVTsBPD

Worried about the Coronavirus and how to prepare? Number one don't panic! Read my op-ed below for more info about how to protect your family and what I am doing in Congress to prevent the spread of diseases like COVID-19.   https://t.co/grrAwRED0b

@RepTedYoho @AVMAvets Veterinarians are uniquely equipped to discover diseases like the coronavirus because of their origination in animals. That's why I introduced a bill to create a new framework for preventing preparing for and responding to zoonotic diseases. #OneHealth

The deadly coronavirus has claimed the lives of 17 people and spread internationally. More than 470 people have contracted the virus. Chinese officials confirmed that the virus came from animals sold at a market and is now spreading human to human.  https://t.co/fncpgHAUCI
